title: [BUG] NoClassDefFoundError due to initialization race condition in HiveThriftServer2

labels.name: reliability
labels.description: Features to improve reliability or bugs that severly impact the reliability of the plugin

body:
See the external user issue for a repro with Superset.

Use Python 3.9 -based venv to [pip install Superset](https://superset.apache.org/docs/installation/installing-superset-from-scratch/#installing-and-initializing-superset)  

```bash
FLASK_APP=superset \
SUPERSET_SECRET_KEY="whatever-secret" \
  superset run -p 8088 --with-threads --reload --debugger
```

Add a Hive database connection `hive://localhost:10000`

It reproduces 100% of the times if the Superset is the first set of JDBC sessions hitting HiveThriftServer2. There are 8 asynchronous JDBC sessions doing various "SHOW NAMESPACES/FUNCTIONS/VIEWS" using a SQLAlchemy-based client.


Known Workarounds:

1. Without rebuilding the jar

pre-warm HiveThrifServer2 with a session without concurrent traffic

```bash
$SPARK_HOME/bin/beeline -u jdbc:hive2://localhost:10000 -e \
  'SHOW NAMESPACES; USE default; SHOW FUNCTIONS; '
```

2. Rebuilding the jar as a conventional single shim jar without parallel worlds

Note that NoClassDefFoundError may simply be over-shadowing a bug in the Scala object initialization which is exposed during the race condition triggered by the Superset's initial traffic.

With workaround 2 helping presumably the bug is somewhere in the classloader initialization.

_Originally posted by @gerashegalov in https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/9867#issuecomment-1839292098_
